Tab.prototype.handle_loaded_page = function(doc)
This method is triggered when a page has been loaded.
Pmog.prototype.handle_server_message_response = function(obj)
This function will parse an json object and send it to the display to be parsed
Pmog.prototype.handle_server_response = function(obj,
panel_id,
clobber)
This function formats the returned JSON object from the server into a format the extension expects.
PmogUser.prototype.has_at_least_one = function(tool)
This method determines if the user has at least one item in their inventory that matches the name of the tool passed in as the parameter.
Page.prototype.has_id = function(id)
This function accepts an ID and returns true or false if it exists in the array of page objects.
Pmog.prototype.has_inventory = function(type)
This function will return a boolean value depending on the inventory levels of the tool specified in the parameter.
Hud.prototype.help = function(event)
This function will open a tab in the browser to the help url on the PMOG server.
Hud.prototype.hide_all = function(msg)
Hide the entire pmog window and show the login window.
Hud.prototype.hide_tools = function(msg)
Certain actions like finding page objects only require the tools to be hidden not the entire hud.
hideAll: function()
Immediately hides all open docks and their children (overlays).
The class that controls most of the direct manipulation tasks available within the extension.
Hud = function()
Initializes the Object
Page.prototype.ids = function()
This function returns an array of all the ids for the various page objects rendered to this tab.
Hud.prototype.ignored_sites = function()
This function opens a xul window displaying sites for PMOG to ignore.
Display.prototype.init = function()
Hud.prototype.init = function()
This function initialize the hud with its default attributes; and checks to see if this is the first time the extension has been used by the player.
Pmog.prototype.init = function()
Initializes the mouse movement listener, which we use to determine if the user is actually playing or just has the browser window open.
TabObserver.prototype.init = function()
Initialize the listeners for all the various tab events and forcefully add a tab to the tab_observer if there are no other tabs open.
SQLiteConnector.prototype.insert_fragment = function(table,
params)
Creates an insert fragment used to create a database record
SQLiteConnector.prototype.invalidate_pragma_cache_for = function(table_name)
This function clears the stored pragma cache for the table provided.
SQLiteConnector.prototype.is_array = function(arr)
Simple function that determines if an object is an array or not
Cached.prototype.is_mostly_harmless = function(aString)
Checks whether the given string contains potentially harmful content which might be executed during its evaluation (no parser, thus not 100% safe! 
PmogUser.prototype.is_playing = function()
Check the preferences to determine if the user is playing.
Tab.prototype.is_tab_selected = function()
Determine if this tab is the currently selected one.
Tab.prototype.isTopLevelDocument = function(aDocument)
Determine if the document in question is the top most document and not an iframe or similar.
SQLiteConnector.prototype.keys_to_binding_parameters = function(attributes)
Format keys into binding parameters used by the Storage API to insert values into the SQL We use binding_parameters instead of just adding values manually to prevent SQL injection.
SQLiteConnector.prototype.keys_to_sql = function(attributes)
Format keys of a hash into a sql string
Hud.prototype.learn_about = function(topic,
event)
This function opens the correct page of the codex associated with the topic passed in
Hud.prototype.level_up_help = function(event)
This function opens a browser to a page, that contains explainations of how to level up.
Hud.prototype.login = function(user)
This function allows the player to attempt to sign into Pmog only after they’ve supplied a username and password to the extension through a message prompt.
PmogSessionManager.prototype.login = function(user,
pass,
callback,
remember_me)
The login function makes the remote login attempt on the Pmog server.
PmogSessionManager.prototype.login_as = function(callback,
ignore_stored_credentials)
Display a prompt screen for the user to enter their PMOG credientials.
Hud.prototype.login_result = function(user,
response_obj)
This function is used as a callback for the login attempt.
Hud.prototype.manage_profiles = function()
This function displays a dialog that allows users to manage their preferences by clearing passwords and preferences at will.
SQLiteConnector.prototype.map_column_type = function(column)
Uses the column hash to choose the best sqlite column type.
Hud.prototype.missions = function(event)
This function opens a browser window to the current player’s missions page.
Pmog.prototype.mouse_moved = function(e)
This function is called anytime the player moves the mouse.
TabObserver.prototype.new_tab = function(panel_id)
Determine if the tab that triggered the event was new or not.
SQLiteConnector.prototype.new_transaction = function()
Prepare the database by starting a transaction
Pmog.prototype.notify = function(opts,
panel_id)
The notify function instructs the Display instance to render a single overlay message to the browser.
Tab.prototype.notify_pmog = function()
Only tell Pmog about the tab once so that it doesn’t get tracked repeatly.
This class converts an object into a variety of differnt formats.
ObjectParser = function(obj)
Initializes the Object
SQLiteConnector.prototype.on_sql_error = function(e,
statement,
sql_message)
Report an error
TinyAjax.prototype.onStateChange = function()
Called each time the readystate changes.
Hud.prototype.openAndReuseOneTabPerURL = function(url,
event)
This function will open a url in a new or existing tab depending if a tab is already open containing the requested url.
openItem: function(itemName)
Creates a new XUL element with the string provided and then appends the newly created element to the dock.
openReply: function(player,
message)
Opens a messageform with the players name in the recipient box unless the messageform is already open in which case it addresses the message to the supplied player
Page.prototype.overlay_count = function()
This function returns the total number of overlays in use.
